events.title: Coronation of Ignatius Loyola as Superior General of the Jesuits
events.description: Ignatius of Loyola was elected the first Superior General of the Society of Jesus (Jesuits), a religious order of the Catholic Church founded to counter the Protestant Reformation.
events.significance: This event marked the formal establishment of the Jesuit order, which played a key role in the Counter-Reformation and in education worldwide.

events.title: First Interstate Baseball Game
events.description: The Brooklyn Bridegrooms played against the New York Giants in the first official game between teams of different leagues, the National League and American Association.
events.significance: This event was an early step toward establishing organized, inter-league professional baseball in the United States.

events.title: Apollo 12 Moon Landing
events.description: Apollo 12, the sixth crewed mission in the United States Apollo program and the second to land on the Moon, successfully touched down on the lunar surface.
events.significance: This mission advanced lunar exploration and demonstrated precise landing capabilities and scientific study on the Moon.

events.title: Magic Johnson Announces HIV Positive Status
events.description: Basketball star Magic Johnson publicly announced that he had tested positive for HIV and was retiring from professional basketball.
events.significance: This announcement raised awareness about HIV/AIDS and challenged stigmas associated with the disease.
